intro: Urostachys jergii, commonly known as the Jergii's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and resemble those of a dandelion. Urostachys jergii is often found in alpine environments and is adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions.
